name: UBS
title: First CAIO from Academic-to-CoE Pipeline

classification.classificationRationale: UBS created a dedicated Chief AI Office responsible for deployment at scale, consistent standards, and technological foundations. CAIO reports to Group Chief CTO — AI placed under technology, not strategy. With 300+ live AI use cases and a formalized governance role, this is a Center of Excellence pattern: central standards body enabling distributed AI deployment across business units. Orientation shifted from auto-classified 'Contextual' to 'Structural' based on explicit structural separation (Chief AI Office as distinct unit).

description:
UBS appointed Daniele Magazzeni as its first Chief Artificial Intelligence Officer effective January 1, 2026, creating a dedicated Chief AI Office responsible for AI tool deployment at scale, maintaining consistent standards, and building technological foundations across the organization. The CAIO reports to the Group Chief CTO (Mike Dargan).

Magazzeni's career represents a distinct CAIO pipeline: Associate Professor of AI at King's College London → JPMorgan global head of Explainable AI Center of Excellence (2021) → JPM Chief Analytics Officer for EMEA and CIB → UBS CAIO. This 'academic → CoE leader → CAIO' trajectory contrasts with the consumer tech pipeline (Mechanism #9).

UBS already had 300+ active AI use cases and 'Big Rocks' large-scale AI initiatives when the CAIO was appointed, suggesting the role was layered on top of existing capability for governance and coordination. The appointment coincides with UBS finalizing the Credit Suisse integration and executive restructuring.

openQuestions: What's the size and structure of the Chief AI Office?
How does the CAIO relate to individual business units' AI initiatives?
What happened to the previous CTO Mike Sheridan who departed?
taxonomyFeedback: UBS exemplifies the 'academic → CoE leader → CAIO' career pipeline (Magazzeni: King's College professor → JPM XAI CoE head → UBS CAIO). This is a distinct pattern from Mechanism #9 (Hire CAIOs from Consumer Tech).
The concurrent CAIO appointment and Credit Suisse integration suggests a pattern: major M&A or restructuring events create windows for formalizing AI governance.

[2026-02] Dargan's framing of CAIO mandate as spanning 'traditional, generative and agentic AI' suggests emerging executive taxonomy for AI modalities. This three-mode framing may become standard for how CAIO scope is communicated.
